speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: SCENE III. A public place.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: There's not a man I meet but doth salute me

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: As if I were their well-acquainted friend;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And every one doth call me by my name.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some tender money to me; some invite me;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some other give me thanks for kindnesses;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some offer me commodities to buy:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Even now a tailor call'd me in his shop

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And show'd me silks that he had bought for me,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And therewithal took measure of my body.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Sure, these are but imaginary wiles

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And Lapland sorcerers inhabit here.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter DROMIO OF SYRACUSE

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, here's the gold you sent me for. What, have

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: you got the picture of old Adam new-apparelled?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: What gold is this? what Adam dost thou mean?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Not that Adam that kept the Paradise but that Adam

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: that keeps the prison: he that goes in the calf's

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: skin that was killed for the Prodigal; he that came

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: behind you, sir, like an evil angel, and bid you

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: forsake your liberty.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I understand thee not.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No? why, 'tis a plain case: he that went, like a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: bass-viol, in a case of leather; the man, sir,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: that, when gentlemen are tired, gives them a sob

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: and 'rests them; he, sir, that takes pity on decayed

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: men and gives them suits of durance; he that sets up

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: his rest to do more exploits with his mace than a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: morris-pike.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: What, thou meanest an officer?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Ay, sir, the sergeant of the band, he that brings

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: any man to answer it that breaks his band; one that

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: thinks a man always going to bed, and says, 'God

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: give you good rest!'

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Well, sir, there rest in your foolery. Is there any

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Why, sir, I brought you word an hour since that the

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: bark Expedition put forth to-night; and then were

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: you hindered by the sergeant, to tarry for the hoy

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Delay. Here are the angels that you sent for to

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: deliver you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The fellow is distract, and so am I;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: And here we wander in illusions:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some blessed power deliver us from hence!

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter a Courtezan

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Well met, well met, Master Antipholus.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I see, sir, you have found the goldsmith now:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Is that the chain you promised me to-day?

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Satan, avoid! I charge thee, tempt me not.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, is this Mistress Satan?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: It is the devil.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Nay, she is worse, she is the devil's dam; and here

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: she comes in the habit of a light wench: and thereof

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: comes that the wenches say 'God damn me;' that's as

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: much to say 'God make me a light wench.' It is

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: written, they appear to men like angels of light:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: light is an effect of fire, and fire will burn;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ergo, light wenches will burn. Come not near her.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Your man and you are marvellous merry, sir.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Will you go with me? We'll mend our dinner here?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, if you do, expect spoon-meat; or bespeak a

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: long spoon.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Why, Dromio?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Marry, he must have a long spoon that must eat with

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: the devil.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Avoid then, fiend! what tell'st thou me of supping?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Thou art, as you are all, a sorceress:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I conjure thee to leave me and be gone.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Give me the ring of mine you had at dinner,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Or, for my diamond, the chain you promised,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And I'll be gone, sir, and not trouble you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Some devils ask but the parings of one's nail,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A rush, a hair, a drop of blood, a pin,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A nut, a cherry-stone;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: But she, more covetous, would have a chain.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Master, be wise: an if you give it her,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The devil will shake her chain and fright us with it.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I pray you, sir, my ring, or else the chain:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: I hope you do not mean to cheat me so.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Avaunt, thou witch! Come, Dromio, let us go.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: 'Fly pride,' says the peacock: mistress, that you know.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Now, out of doubt Antipholus is mad,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Else would he never so demean himself.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: A ring he hath of mine worth forty ducats,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And for the same he promised me a chain:

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Both one and other he denies me now.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: The reason that I gather he is mad,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Besides this present instance of his rage,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Is a mad tale he told to-day at dinner,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Of his own doors being shut against his entrance.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Belike his wife, acquainted with his fits,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: On purpose shut the doors against his way.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: My way is now to hie home to his house,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: And tell his wife that, being lunatic,

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: He rush'd into my house and took perforce

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: My ring away. This course I fittest choose;

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: For forty ducats is too much to lose.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Exit
